1.heading: Stories Without Words.
1.title: Anno's Animals
1.author: Mitsumasa Anno.
notes: Summary: The reader is invited to find a variety of animals hidden amidst woodland scenes.

2.heading: Stories Without Words.
2.title: Anno's Italy
2.author: Mitsumasa Anno.
notes: Japanese edition entitled My journey II, which is a translation of Tabi no ehon, II.
Summary: A pictorial presentation of rural, town, and city scenes in Italy, which contain hidden images from fine arts, religion, history, and folklore.

3.heading: Stories Without Words.
3.title: Anno's Journey
3.author: Mitsumasa Anno.
notes: Published in 1977 under title: My journey, which is a translation of Tabi no ehon.
Summary: Records in drawings the author's journey through northern Europe and his impressions of the land, the people at work and play, and their art, architecture, folklore, and fairy tales.

4.heading: Stories Without Words.
4.title: "Awaken"
4.author: by Martin Springett
4.appears_in: p. 16-23 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 8 (Nov. 1980).

5.heading: Stories Without Words.
5.title: Between the Lines
5.author: Fougasse.
notes: Captioned picture stories, and some stories without words.
"The contents of this book are reproduced from Punch."

6.heading: Stories Without Words.
6.title: Beyond Words : a Wordless Comic Anthology.
6.author: [No author]

8.heading: Stories Without Words.
8.title: Blood Song : a Silent Ballad
8.author: Eric Drooker ; introduction by Joe Sacco.

9.heading: Stories Without Words.
9.title: A Book of Fiction
9.author: by Jan Sawka ; foreword by James Beck.
notes: A series of plates interpenetrated by blocks of unintelligible words; a story without real words.

10.heading: Stories Without Words.
10.title: Cathy. book 1
10.author: by Don Lawrence.
notes: Each opening is a series of pictures that tell a story without words, in a pinup style.

11.heading: Stories Without Words.
11.title: Charlie Bob's Fan
11.author: W
notes: Summary: A dog who tries everything he can think of to turn on a fan on a hot day is outdone by a cat who accidentally trips the switch.

12.heading: Stories Without Words.
12.title: "Citizens Beware"
12.author: by Mark Fisher
12.appears_in: p. 33-39 in Heavy Metal, v. 3, no. 3 (July 1979).

15.heading: Stories Without Words.
15.title: Comix 2000.
15.author: [No author]
notes: Foreword in parallel text in the following languages: French, English, Spanish, German, Dutch, Japanese, Portuguese, Italian, Norwegian, and Finnish.
Presents comics stories (without words) by 324 authors from 29 countries. The contributions are predominantly of Franco-Belgian origin.

16.heading: Stories Without Words.
16.title: "Contact"
16.author: by Fishmonger
16.appears_in: p. 33-36 in Heavy Metal : Sci-Fi Special (Heavy Metal Special ; v. 12, no. 1, Spring 1998)

19.heading: Stories Without Words.
19.title: "Création du Groupe Belge B.D."
19.author: Claude Moliterni
notes: Brief article on current comics in Belgium includes reprints of two early (1880) Belgian comics pages, stories without words, from the weekly Le Rieur Illustré. The stories are titled "Un Orateur" and "A Quatre Mains" (about playing the piano).

20.heading: Stories Without Words.
20.title: Cycle Club Initiation
20.author: Tom of Finland.
notes: Story summary in words inside front cover.

22.heading: Stories Without Words.
22.title: Des Bonshommes : 1r série
22.author: par A

contents.title: "Mme Béatrice, Langues Vivantes, 5 à 7, Rue de Londres"
"Le Corsage de Madame ne va pas"

notes: Each leaf is a brief story without words.

23.heading: Stories Without Words.
23.title: Des Bonshommes : 2me série
23.author: par A

contents.title: "Tu n'as pas Trois Louis jusqu'a Demain?"

notes: Each leaf is a brief story without words.

24.heading: Stories Without Words.
24.title: "Desert Dream"* 4 p. in Truckin', no. 2
24.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The driver of a panel truck pulls over in the desert to sleep, and dreams he's driving a steam-powered truck to a settlement of people in circus tents.

25.heading: Stories Without Words.
25.title: Destiny : a Novel in Pictures
25.author: O
notes: Story without words, printed on one side of leaf only.

28.heading: Stories Without Words.
28.title: "Discover America"

29.title: Dissections : a Treatise on Human Nature

notes: 100 leaves of plates : all ill. ; 22 cm.

32.heading: Stories Without Words.
32.title: Doug Wright's Family.

notes: "Featured in the Canadian Magazine and Star Weekly."
Wordless comic strips, each one page (2 tiers) in length.

34.heading: Stories Without Words.
34.title: "The Empire Grows Back"
34.author: by Don Butler

36.heading: Stories Without Words.
36.title: "Exquisite Corpses"

37.title: "Exquisite Corpses"

38.heading: Stories Without Words.
38.title: Filipino Food

38.genre: Stories without words in underground genre.

39.heading: Stories Without Words.
39.author: by Mark Fisher
39.appears_in: p. 14-16 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 5 (Aug. 1981).
notes: Summary: Almost wordless story, about a work day.

41.heading: Stories Without Words.
41.title: Flood! : a Novel in Pictures
41.author: by Eric Drooker.
notes: "Flood! is the story of a city dweller in the last days of the Twentieth Century. Part autobiography, part fantasy, Flood! tells the tale of a post-industrial native, of his hopes, dreams, and fears; of his survival in a world of concrete, metal and plastic; of his passionate vision of modern civilization and its effect upon the human soul"

42.heading: Stories Without Words.
42.title: "Frolix"
42.author: by George Metzger
42.appears_in: p. 69-73 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 12 (Mar. 1983).
notes: Title and most dialogue in alien characters, making this in effect a strip without words.

44.heading: Stories Without Words.
44.title: "Georgik"
44.author: by Georgik
44.appears_in: p. 45 in Heavy Metal, v. 2, no. 4 (Aug. 1978).
notes: Summary: A machine that seems to monitor dreams shows an exploding bomb, and the dreamer's head blows off. Story without words.

45.heading: Stories Without Words.
45.title: God's Man : a novel in woodcuts
45.author: by Lynd Ward.

publication info.publisher: chiefly ill. ; 20 cm. 1. Stories without words. I. Ward, Lynd

46.heading: Stories Without Words.
46.title: "The Gold Digger"
46.author: Moebius
46.appears_in: 5 p. in Moebius 1/2 (Anaheim, CA : Graphitti Designs, 1991).
notes: Summary: A man on the beach with a metal detector in transported into an alien presence, and gets a gold coin. Story without words, drawn in 1986 and first published in Heavy Metal, Summer 1987.

48.heading: Stories Without Words.
48.title: "Harzack"
48.author: Moebius
48.appears_in: 2 p. black and white in Moebius 0 (Milwaukie, OR : Dark Dark Horse Comics, 1990).
notes: Summary: A character urinates on the ground, and police arrive and attempt to arrest him; urine engulfs the police car and the character runs behind a large rock, where another character is defecating. Story without words.

49.heading: Stories Without Words.
49.title: Hiccup
49.author: by Mercer Mayer.
notes: SUMMARY: Mr. Hippopotamus's efforts to cure his friend's hiccups become increasingly irritating to her.

50.heading: Stories Without Words.
50.title: How Santa Claus had a Long and Difficult Journey Delivering His Presents
50.author: by Fernando Krahn.
notes: Summary: Pictures without words show Santa Claus trying to get airborne after the reindeer break away from their traces.

51.heading: Stories Without Words.
51.title: "Hydrogenesis"
51.author: by Caza
51.appears_in: p. 60-65 in Heavy Metal, v. 2, no. 10 (Feb. 1979).
notes: Story without words, in full-page panels.

52.heading: Stories Without Words.

publication info.place: First work originally published: Die Idee. Geneva

notes: Works issued back-to-back and inverted; book, 1 sheet (43 x 64 cm. folded to 11 x 17 cm.) and 4 postcards (12 x 16 cm.) issued in box.

55.heading: Stories Without Words.
55.title: Jack in the Jungle.

notes: Summary: Jack is shipwrecked and rescued by a white jungle man, then together they are captured by black jungle men, and rescued by a lion.

70.heading: Stories Without Words.
70.title: Mélisande
70.author: foreword and story by Margery Sharp ; drawings by Roy McKie.
notes: In a story without words, Mélisande is a dog who becomes a famous opera singer, then retires to sing with the Salvation Army.

71.heading: Stories Without Words.
71.title: "Metamorphosis"
71.author: Moebius
71.appears_in: 24 p. in Moebius 0 (Milwaukie, OR : Dark Dark Horse Comics, 1990).
notes: Summary: Wordless sequence in full-page panels, in the style of flip animation. A man's face and hand explode with a substance that engulfs him, hardens into a hollow egg-like object, and shatters revealing another man.

110.heading: Stories Without Words.

notes: Summary: In a wordless chain of events, a boy's toy monkey is lost and retrieved only after it passes through many hands.

112.heading: Stories Without Words.
112.title: The Worm : the Longest Comic Strip in the World
112.author: by Alan Moore and a galaxy of greats.
notes: "In one single working day, over 125 British cartoonists gathered together in one place to create 'the longest comic strip in the world.'"
Introductions and explanatory text in English, Swedish and French.
Published in association with The Cartoon Art Trust and The Swedish Council for Cultural Affairs.

113.heading: Stories Without Words.
113.title: Y a des Dames : Album en Couleurs
113.author: par A
notes: Most leaves have three or more drawings in sequence telling a brief story, some without words.

Story contents: "Spiritisme" ; "Les Honneurs du Pied" ; "Dis moi ce que tu Chantes, je te dirais ce que tu Peins" ; "Le Songe d'une Nuit d'Hiver" ; "La Classe!" ; "Ce qu'on ne Voit pas au Bal de l'Opera" ; "Premiers Froids" ; "Souvent Femmes Varient" ; "Les Suites d'un Premier Lit" ; "Les Étrennes à Travers les Ages" ; "Une Crémaillère" ; "Ce qui vient de la Flute s'en Retourne au Tambour" ; "Colin-Maillard" ; "Un Chien qui Rapporte" ; "Veuf Consolable" ; "Une Visite à L'Atelier" ; "Chaste et Flétri" ; "Avant le Salon : Illusion d'Optique" ; "Une Berceuse"

115.heading: Stories Without Words--Articles About.
115.title: "Breaking Taboos : Sexuality in the Work of Will Eisner and the Early Wordless Novels"
115.author: David A
115.appears_in: Beronä. p. 90-103 in International Journal of Comic Art, v. 1, no. 1 (Spring/Summer 1999).
notes: Relates Eisner's work to the work of Otto Nückel, Franz Masereel, Lynd Ward.

116.heading: Stories Without Words--Articles About.
116.title: "Pictures Speak in Comics Without Words : Pictorial Principles in the Work of Milt Gross, Hendrik Dorgathen, Eric Drooker, and Peter Kuper"
116.author: David A
116.appears_in: Beronä. p. 19-39 in The Language of Comics : Word and Image (Jackson : University Press of Mississippi, 2001).

117.heading: Stories Without Words--Articles About.
117.title: "Willette, Steinlen, et les histoires sans paroles du Chat Noir"
117.author: David Kunzle
117.appears_in: p. 29-38 in L'Humour Graphique Fin de Siècle (Saint-Denis : Presses Universitaires de Vincennes, 1999).
notes: About artists Willette, Théophile-Alexandre Steinlen (1859-1923), and the magazine Chat Noir (1882-1895).

118.heading: Stories Without Words--Bibliography.
118.title: "Stories Without Words : A Bibliography with Annotations"
118.author: compiled by Michael Rhode, Tom Furtwangler, and David Wybenga
118.appears_in: p. 265-306 in International Journal of Comic Art, v. 2, no. 2 (Fall 2000)

119.heading: Stories Without Words--Miscellanea.
119.title: "Danger, Pictures Ahead"
119.author: by R
119.appears_in: C. Harvey. p. 100-106 in The Comics Journal, no. 242 (Apr. 2002).
notes: On stories without words, on people taking offense at pictures, and particularly on people's reactions to Johnny Hart's religious B.C. strips, and other religious content in comics and cartoons.

120.title: "Stories Written by Carl Wessler for Timely Comics, 1956 : Bibliography : taken from his personal account book pages"
120.author: Mary Wessler
